snippet: A band of children outside the headquarters of the coalition forces in Afghanistan sells scarves, hats and books almost every day, except when they are kicked out by the police.
abstract: Kabul Journal; band of Afghan children gather almost every day outside headquarters of the coalition forces in Afghanistan to sell scarves, hats and books to Western soldiers stationed there.

byline.contributor: Habib Zahori and Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A band of children outside the headquarters of the coalition forces in Afghanistan sells scarves, hats and books almost every day, except when they are kicked out by the police.

headline.seo: A Youthful Corps Whose Esprit Comes From Hustle
